capsules_submitted.utterance: Snape is indeed a male character in the Harry Potter series. I've always found him to be quite an intriguing figure, with his complex and often dark personality. His strict demeanor and sharp tongue can be intimidating at times, but there's also a depth to him that makes him more than just a one-dimensional villain.

Snape, the way he's always been portrayed as this intimidating figure in the wizarding world is really quite fascinating. I mean, his gender being male is just a fact, but it's interesting to see how that aspect of him has been used to shape his character throughout the series. He's definitely not someone you'd want to mess with, and that sense of authority and power is pretty captivating.

Snape, the way he carries himself is so intimidating, but I think that's part of what makes him such a compelling character. I mean, as a male, he's definitely not afraid to show his emotions, even if they are often hidden beneath the surface.
